reviews.text: A turning point in the DC Extended Universe came when Patty Jenkins' Wonder Woman climbed out of the trenches.
reviews.author: Jennifer Bisset

reviews.text: Gal Gadot proved to be a worthy successor to LGBT ally extraordinaire Lynda Carter.
reviews.author: Brian T. Carney

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is fierce feminist filmmaking at its finest, featuring a powerhouse poignant performance from Gal Gadot, a truly ravishing romance that harkens back to Old Hollywood, and an effervescent sense of earnest optimism.
reviews.author: Zoë Rose Bryant

reviews.text: A visual splendor of precise period recreation and breathtaking superhero action. An emotional exploration of human proclivities towards good and evil and the ugliness of oppression and suffering.
reviews.author: Keith Garlington

reviews.text: Whether it represents a cog in a larger universe, a historical watershed for women’s leadership, or the answered prayers of long-suffering fans and idolizing dreamers, "Wonder Woman" is valiant, momentous, and satisfying.
reviews.author: Don Shanahan

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is flawed, clichéd, imperfect. But it has moments -- more than a few -- where I found myself shedding a slight tear. Sometimes sadness. Sometimes elation.
reviews.author: Jane Fae

reviews.text: Wonder Woman features an optimistic, brave, compassionate, and relatively well-adjusted character - a refreshing change of pace from the moody bunch that preceded her.
reviews.author: Brian Eggert

reviews.text: It's a big moment for blockbuster filmmaking  the next step in diversifying Hollywood storytelling on the big stage. In that effort, dare we say, it does a wonderful job.
reviews.author: Cory Woodroof

reviews.text: The Jenkins / Heinberg duo gave Hollywood a valuable lesson: the "underdogs" of indie cinema and television have much to contribute to contemporary action cinema that urgently needs new blood to avoid repeating formulas [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Luis Bond

reviews.text: Diana Prince is both compassionate, gentle, and peace-loving while at the same time strong, uncompromising where important, and unwilling to be pushed around.
reviews.author: Hosea Rupprecht

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is the right movie at the right time -- and for all the right reasons.
reviews.author: Matt Brunson

reviews.text: It's not a stretch to say that Wonder Woman is the best of the recent DC Comics movies, but that's kind of damning with faint praise.
reviews.author: Alex Bentley

reviews.text: It showed a female-led comic book conquest was worth doing, especially when it leveraged well-executed period-piece elements with delightful sidekick chemistry...it proved everything didn't have to be dark and brooding in order to reach an audience.
reviews.author: Nathan Mattise

reviews.text: Wonder is Badass thanks to Patty Jenkins and Gal Gadot. PAcked with action, adventure and the type of diverse cast I wish was prevalent in most Hollywood blackbusters!
reviews.author: Carla Renata

reviews.text: It's taken a while, but the first ever superhero film with both a female protagonist and director is an absolute delight.
reviews.author: Dan Brightmore

reviews.text: Entries into the Marvel Cinematic Universe continue to take chances and clean up at the box office but even the most cynical of us are eagerly awaiting what Patty Jenkins and Gal Gadot have in store next.
reviews.author: Jim Rohner

reviews.text: It's easily the best film in the DC Extended Universe (DCEU) thus far. But what does that mean when your yardstick is [Man of Steel, Batman vs. Superman, and Suicide Squad]?
reviews.author: Kendra James

reviews.text: Piercing through a lot of the nonsense and bombast, this is pretty crude nationalist and pro-war propaganda.
reviews.author: David Walsh

reviews.text: The overuse of computer-augmented imagery and wirework and fully computer-animated characters makes everything look just a bit faker, especially during showdowns.
reviews.author: Mike Massie

reviews.text: Diana's a strong role model for young girls as she's a fighter and has no time for the typical gender roles placed in society.
reviews.author: Paul McGuire Grimes

reviews.text: Gal Gadot is simply extraordinary.
reviews.author: Richard Propes

reviews.text: Wonder Woman would have been a powerful statement just by its mere existence. Instead, we are treated to a definitive genre classic in its own right.
reviews.author: Leigh Monson

reviews.text: Wonder Woman deserves the success and praise not just because the film is about an empowering female superhero that will undoubtedly inspire the younger generation and women alike - it's just a good film period.
reviews.author: Kelechi Ehenulo

reviews.text: Go see Wonder Woman solely for the fact that it's a fantastic, well made, exciting and emotional film. In fact, I can honestly say, without hyperbole, that this is one of the best superhero movies ever.
reviews.author: Damond Fudge

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is not only the depiction of a powerful woman that men and women alike needs to see, it's a metaphor for ourselves as well. It's a win for a comic movie universe that very much needed one.
reviews.author: Murjani Rawls

reviews.text: This film is full of 'fish-out-of-water' humour which comes from a demi-god negotiating the world of men. It is also visually stunning and the action scenes are thrilling - coupling the world of superheroes with WWI works surprisingly well.
reviews.author: Fiona Underhill

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a flawed superhero origin story. With that out of the way, the good news is it's mostly awesome, brings one of the greatest comic book characters ever to the big screen, and breaks up the boys' club that is contemporary superhero cinema.
reviews.author: Brent McKnight

reviews.text: Although it has a charismatic role from Gal Gadot, it has nothing exciting for two hours that turns wonderful to yawn. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Yasser Medina

reviews.text: It was totally entertaining. I'm excited to see more of these movies.
reviews.author: Avaryl Halley

reviews.text: Part of what I really liked about this movie was that it focused on her as a character and a human being.
reviews.author: Andrew Galdi

reviews.text: Judged on equal footing as all other superhero films, as it and all movies should be, this is a terrific action film, a sly take on gender politics of the early 1900s, and a wonderfully crafted antiwar picture.
reviews.author: Steven Prokopy

reviews.text: ... the directing by Patty Jenkins who shows that she can take a good script and turn out great scenes and coherence. Her way of directing works fantastically well with lead Gal Gadot's interpretation of Wonder Woman.
reviews.author: Emilie Black

reviews.text: Wonder Woman stands proudly on its own, and a frankly astonishing sequence of Diana crossing No Man's Land alone pushes a fun blockbuster directly into iconic territory.
reviews.author: Tim Brennan

reviews.text: At least, finally the DCCU seems willing to learn from its mistakes and improve over previous entries.
reviews.author: Jorge Ignacio Castillo

reviews.text: Gal Gadot's performance is fantastic to watch, she not only carries the entire film, but she also brings strength, intelligence, compassion and beauty to her role.
reviews.author: Sarah Knight Adamson

reviews.text: Making the Hero with a Thousand Faces a woman proves the primal power of the oldest story by opening it up to half the world. After untold thousands of years, it still works.
reviews.author: Chris McCoy

reviews.text: Jenkins' Diana is vulnerable but strong, compassionate but fierce, good-hearted but no pushover. This film is a solid springboard for Diana to be fleshed out in further instalments.
reviews.author: Grethe Kemp

reviews.text: Wonder Woman brings joy and compassion to the DC Universe.
reviews.author: Aly Caviness

reviews.text: Gal Gadot is perfect in this role as she conveys compassion, athleticism and a sense of innocence as she experiences life outside of Themyscira.
reviews.author: Katie Smith-Wong

reviews.text: Kudos for all those involved at DC and Warner Bros. in making this woman-helmed and woman-led film so very entertaining.
reviews.author: Leslie Combemale

reviews.text: Gadot - who I'm not yet convinced is a great actor - is one hundred percent perfect in this role, to the extent that it would be a much poorer movie without the zeal and charisma which she brings to the titular Princess of the Amazons.
reviews.author: Rhys Tarling

reviews.text: Not a great film, but it is a good one.
reviews.author: Kate Rodger

reviews.text: Not only is Wonder Woman an action film for all ages and genders, but it has a great positive message: no matter how ugly the world gets because of war and dictators, we must be good, protect one another and do right by one other.
reviews.author: Linda and Al Lerner

reviews.text: The superhero film is dripping with engaging characters and you find yourself engrossed with the story. But the film takes a sharp detour in its second half to unveil something incredibly formulaic and predictable.
reviews.author: Chris Sawin

reviews.text: A triumph and the first truly great DC Films release, Wonder Woman exceeds every expectation and stands tall as one of the greatest superhero movies of all-time.
reviews.author: Josh Wilding

reviews.text: Its brain, sense of spectacle, its excellent visual and its approach to an icon of popular culture place it as one of the best superhero movies since 'The Dark Knight' of Christopher Nolan. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Víctor López G.

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a pure delight.
reviews.author: Karl Delossantos

reviews.text: . Where Snyder's films thus far have been dismal 9/11 rehashing oddities, Jenkins has made the first film to capture the magic DC's always represented in the four color world. It's a treasure to have it here on the silver screen.
reviews.author: Dominic Griffin

reviews.text: In her own movie, Wonder Woman has less lines of dialogue than her "supporting" love interest, expresses no personality and doesn't even really save the day.
reviews.author: Ryan Syrek

reviews.text: Rather than a reliance on flashy effects and over-the-top, apocalyptic plots, Wonder Woman  remains grounded in a totally refreshing way.
reviews.author: Mattie Lucas

reviews.text: For the film to reach its conclusion Diana must be confronted by the limits and power of humankind. She must understand the wonder of humanity. And for the film to work, we must be in wonder of her. And we are.
reviews.author: Andrew Kendall

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is easily the best DCEU movie to date. The CGI is sub par, but is forgotten during the epic battles, and thrilling plot points.
reviews.author: Tessa Smith

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is awesome and awe-inspiring. An all-round captivating piece of cinema.
reviews.author: Deirdre Molumby

reviews.text: Wonder Woman may not be perfect, but it's a validation for young girls everywhere of their strength and value, and it's the first superhero film in a long time that made me look forward to a sequel.
reviews.author: Julie Crawford

reviews.text: The imperative to eradicate any hint of bossiness or anger from her character weighs heavily on the film, threatening to turn it into one long, dispiriting exercise in allaying male fears about powerful women.
reviews.author: Zoe Heller

reviews.text: Congrats to Patty Jenkins and everyone involved for finally giving me a blockbuster I actually cared about! Thank you!
reviews.author: Rachel Wagner

reviews.text: Wonder Woman not only fulfils all the criteria of a superhero movie but is also engaging, exciting and inspiring throughout
reviews.author: Becky Kukla

reviews.text: Gal Gadot absolutely rocks as the mighty Wonder Woman, as well as the sweet and compassionate Diana. It's not just the best DCEU film so far, it's a solid and hugely entertaining film, period.
reviews.author: Ruth Maramis

reviews.text: Some aspects of the story are also a bit over the top, but then again, it is a superhero movie. Overall, go watch it.
reviews.author: S. Indra Sathiabalan

reviews.text: The opening act drags with exposition and the climax slips into the same fire and brimstone mixtape so beloved of DC. But that status also buys it an inspiring, revolutionary spirit that your average neighborhood superhero film can only dream of.
reviews.author: Tom Bond

reviews.text: ...a wholesome good-versus-evil film that's surely bound for success.
reviews.author: Deborah Cornelious

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is smart and engaging, funny and fun; there's far more humor and heart here than in any other DC offering.
reviews.author: Allen Adams

reviews.text: Director Patty Jenkins knocks it out of the park with this film.
reviews.author: Amanda Greever

reviews.text: We've never had a superhero film directed by a female director, and after what Jenkins has delivered, this clearly needs to change immediately.
reviews.author: Doug Jamieson

reviews.text: Wonder Woman, simply put, is a wonder.
reviews.author: Nathalia Aryani

reviews.text: Like Zeus breathing life into the world creating man, so does [director Patty] Jenkins breathe life into the DCEU.
reviews.author: Douglas Davidson

reviews.text: It isn't groundbreaking in structure, but its exhibition of strong female heroism amidst conflicts of the past just elevates everything...
reviews.author: Colby Bryant

reviews.text: A nuanced message of hope and mercy in a violent world? A superhero motivated by love and a desire for peace? A visionary portrayal of femininity in all its beauty, complexity, and strength? I'm with her.
reviews.author: Joel Mayward

reviews.text: This is an exciting moment for women all over the world, make no mistake. But the outdated source material hinders Wonder Woman from reaching full-out beast mode.
reviews.author: Li Lai

reviews.text: With the disappointment of Batman vs. Superman and Suicide Squad, DC proves they may have found their magic again.
reviews.author: Sharronda Williams

reviews.text: It's not really possible to fully divorce Wonder Woman from the fact that its simple existence feels like a big, revolutionary "event" in and of itself.
reviews.author: Bob Chipman

reviews.text: Easily joins the ranks of some of the best first outings for a superhero in the last two decades.
reviews.author: Patrick Bromley

reviews.text: Jenkins has a keen eye for the action sequences, staging some elaborate moments stylistically. With the help of Gardot's performance, there is humanity in this character that has been sorely lacking in [DC movies].
reviews.author: Micheal Compton

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is undeniably the strongest entry in the ever-expanding DC Extended Universe.
reviews.author: Zaki Hasan

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is not just the first great female-led superhero movie ... but an astounding example of modern blockbuster filmmaking in general.
reviews.author: Jennifer Heaton

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is unmarred by the cynicism, grim and gritty attitudes, and humorless self-seriousness that have plagued the early entries in the DCEU.
reviews.author: Sean Mulvihill

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is not just the best film in the [DCEU] to date. It isn't just one of the best origin stories to date. It's simply one of the best superhero films made, period.
reviews.author: Johnny Gayzmonic

reviews.text: It merges the best parts of Thor and Captain America into an origin story possessed with increased character complexities despite its generic plot.
reviews.author: Jared Mobarak

reviews.text: If you are still in the camp of "DC cannot get it right", I implore you to take a chance on Wonder Woman. Diana Prince is more than a demigod with the power to bring down the mighty. She's the hero we deserve.
reviews.author: Aaron Peterson

reviews.text: The sappy romance might be a bit much for some, but there's a sense of optimism and play in Wonder Woman that feels invigorating after the dismal death wheeze of more recent DC efforts.
reviews.author: Alex Casey

reviews.text: With the film on-course for a stellar opening weekend ... the period superhero movie proves itself to be a exciting and entertaining entry to the DC cinematic universe
reviews.author: Kimberly Pierce

reviews.text: The refreshing superhero film the DCEU desperately needed.
reviews.author: Rendy Jones

reviews.text: Wonder Woman has greatness to it -- because of its hero, because of its spirit, and because it is done absolutely right.
reviews.author: Abbie Bernstein

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is far from a perfect film, but it's brave and smart enough to be granted a well-deserved sequel.
reviews.author: Akhil Arora

reviews.text: Patty Jenkin's Wonder Woman is an entertaining, exciting film. I was surprised by how refreshed I was that Wonder Woman was a good person.
reviews.author: Jourdain Searles

reviews.text: This is Diana's journey, and it is a beautiful and affecting indictment of the kind of people who have power yet can move through the world without using those powers for good.
reviews.author: Molly Templeton

reviews.text: This film is very much the hero's journey, end-to-end, and it did such a good job that I forgot it was doing that. I was just lost in the story.
reviews.author: Jaby Koay

reviews.text: As a summer blockbuster with blistering action, charm to burn and plenty of potential, it's a hit.
reviews.author: Alison Rowat

reviews.text: "Wonder Woman" lives up to its hype, and DC Comics' example of a strong, independent, fit woman is something to support.
reviews.author: Pamela Powell

reviews.text: Her journey in realizing that humans have a darkness and light in them is a tough lesson to learn, but her continued belief in that light is nicely done. Superhero fan or not, "Wonder Woman" is worth seeing.
reviews.author: Mae Abdulbaki

reviews.text: The performances, the plot, the music, the art direction -- everything about this film is movie making at it's best.
reviews.author: Lisa Johnson Mandell

reviews.text: The energy here is warm, unmistakably feminine, and the balance of light-hearted humor and melodrama sets this production apart from the somber, alpha-male brooding of its DCEU predecessors.
reviews.author: Rubén Rosario

reviews.text: Bad news, haters: Wonder Woman is good.
reviews.author: Deirdre Crimmins

reviews.text: It's told very well sans clumsy clutter and the pacing is perfect. Jenkin gets high marks for humor and for the delicate handling the romance between Gadot and the charismatic Pine who,... almost has you rooting for him to win.
reviews.author: Lapacazo Magrira Sandoval

reviews.text: With director Patty Jenkins at the helm, Wonder Woman was in the hands of someone who was more than capable of doing Diana's story justice.
reviews.author: Britany Murphy

reviews.text: Wonder Woman flips nearly every gendered superhero trope it encounters.
reviews.author: Heather Hogan

reviews.text: Bottom line: The movie is terrific, just the breath of fresh air Warners needs.
reviews.author: Leah Sydney

reviews.text: Wonder Woman sits, as she should, both with the pantheon of great heroes, as well as above it.
reviews.author: Tom Fitzgerald and Lorenzo Marquez

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is the superhero movie that I've been waiting to see and, I suspect, after a string of critical failures the one DC wanted to make.
reviews.author: Stassa Edwards

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a terrifically fun movie, deftly balancing action sequences and emotional beats. Gal Gadot is charismatic as the eponymous anti-war Amazon princess.
reviews.author: Annalee Newitz

reviews.text: The script by is unusually introspective
reviews.author: Mark R. Leeper

reviews.text: Wonder Woman isn't bogged down by seriousness and cynicism. Even in its many moments where it reaches for some sort of relevance, it still manifests an affinity for unabashed spectacle and enjoyment.
reviews.author: Oggs Cruz

reviews.text: While the future of the DCEU still remains very much in doubt, at least most will agree that the first major female-led superhero movie in years is a rousing success.
reviews.author: Shaun Munro

reviews.text: Watching Wonder Woman felt like breathing out a sigh of relief.
reviews.author: Eliza C. Thompson

reviews.text: I just really liked seeing a superhero that WANTS to be a superhero in a superhero movie.
reviews.author: Andre Meadows

reviews.text: It represents a clear-eyed view of the world.
reviews.author: Megan Basham

reviews.text: After three underwhelming films, Warner Bros. Pictures finally finds the formula for success with director Patty Jenkins' live-action Wonder Woman.
reviews.author: Rick Marshall

reviews.text: There are some problems with pacing...but the movie as a whole has a lot of good payoff.
reviews.author: Jeremy Jahns

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a solid piece of work, well worth watching, and hopefully a harbinger of better things to come from DC in the near future.
reviews.author: Christopher Llewellyn Reed

reviews.text: Gal Gadot IS Wonder Woman.
reviews.author: Steph Cozza

reviews.text: A strong entry in the comic-book superhero action film genre, with a plot that's compelling without being confusing, great special effects, strong villains, some inspirational 'girl power' scenes, crisp pacing....
reviews.author: James Plath

reviews.text: [Gal] Gadot is particularly memorable as the lead character here.
reviews.author: John Hanlon

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a simply perfect product. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Irene Zoe Alameda

reviews.text: First and foremost, this is a fun film from start to finish, with gorgeous visuals, an amazing score and perfect pacing.
reviews.author: Carl Kozlowski

reviews.text: ... Wonder Woman is an improvement over the recent onslaught of oft-tedious comics-based movies.
reviews.author: Al Hoff

reviews.text: I'm confident Wonder Woman is one of the best superhero movies ever made. I can't wait to get back to the theater and watch it again.
reviews.author: Jason Guerrasio

reviews.text: It's not difficult to see where this route is going, but that doesn't make it any less enjoyable to watch. The simple power of love is the cornerstone upon which Wonder Woman is built. If it seems earnest, it's because it is.
reviews.author: Karen Han

reviews.text: I felt empowered and I'm not wonderful or a woman. You can view Wonder Woman and her first solo entry movie as a feminist icon, but honestly, it's so much more than that. She inspires us all to be more caring and better to one another
reviews.author: Robert Kojder

reviews.text: It's thrilling that Wonder Woman is enjoying the critical and commercial success that it is. But, in some ways it's also unfair. There is more weight than one film by one director about one woman should bear.
reviews.author: Alexandra MacAaron

reviews.text: Gal Gadot's perfect blend of battlefield courage and uncomplicated compassion provides a formidable champion we have fun rooting for.
reviews.author: Blake Crane

reviews.text: The Wonder Woman that we needed. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Irene Crespo

reviews.text: Wonder Woman Lives Up to the Hype
reviews.author: Danielle Solzman

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is alive and in command in ways the other DCEU films can only dream about. It is, in short, heroic.
reviews.author: Chris Evangelista

reviews.text: This is undoubtedly the strongest DCEU outing till now, one that will add a new world of (female) fans to the franchise, and for all the right reasons.
reviews.author: Neil Soans

reviews.text: Gadot, who almost stole last years "Batman V Superman: Dawn of Justice," is outstanding here as the Amazon goddess who not only learns about her destiny but that of her people.
reviews.author: Michael A. Smith

reviews.text: [Chris Pine's] chemistry with [Gal] Gadot is sparkling. But this is film is all about Wonder Woman. And Gadot looks like she was born to bring this legend to life on the big screen.
reviews.author: Rachit Gupta

reviews.text: [Wonder Woman's] greatest mert is to reinvent all the genres it touches from a woman's perspective. [Full Review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Beatriz Martínez

reviews.text: "Wonder Woman" just isn't that good of a movie
reviews.author: Jordan Ruimy

reviews.text: A ponderous film that contains the Michael Bay esthetic beneath a thin veneer of faux feminism.
reviews.author: Louis Proyect

reviews.text: Despite its flaws, Wonder Woman is every bit as epic as Batman v. Superman or Suicide Squad, yet has the humanity and emotion that those movies sorely lacked, despite being smaller-scaled.
reviews.author: Ryan Pollard

reviews.text: It's the film that might just turn Gal Gadot into a real film star. She's touchingly good, bringing a genuine emotional depth to a part that, in others' hands, could easily have none at all.
reviews.author: Matthew Bond

reviews.text: There is great pleasure in the matter-of-fact way Jenkins and Heinberg make points about chauvinism, sexism, and equality through pointed humor and practical examples, and how deftly Diana sweeps aside all attempts by men to dismiss her.
reviews.author: Sean Axmaker

reviews.text: Amid stunning visuals, well-crafted action sequences and a decent plot, Gal Gadot's nuanced performance speaks volumes.
reviews.author: Jordan Hoffman

reviews.text: DC Comics should send a huge thank-you hamper to Patty Jenkins.
reviews.author: Joanne Soh

reviews.text: ... stands on its own as an action-packed, enjoyable piece of escapism.
reviews.author: George M. Thomas

reviews.text: While I'm not a big fan of superhero movies, Petty Jenkins' Wonder Woman proved to be entertainingly in its own unique way.
reviews.author: Rob Lowman

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is an exciting and welcome addition to the DC live action universe. She is strong and smart and capable-and also exceptionally beautiful, but it is the former qualities that are given the greatest focus.
reviews.author: Keeva Stratton

reviews.text: The new Wonder Woman from director Patty Jenkins has an effective story, borrowing fictional archetypes while offering something original.
reviews.author: tt stern-enzi

reviews.text: But this attempted revamp of the boys-club superhero genre dares to suggest that a person of conscience might put her invincible physical prowess to better use by seeking to end the carnage of warfare, not just fight to win.
reviews.author: Lisa Jensen

reviews.text: Now that Wonder Woman's backstory is finally on the books, let's hope the filmmakers can come up with fresher installments in the future.
reviews.author: André Hereford

reviews.text: A correct film, effective, with some problems in its development, but it's the most laudable that DC has done so far. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Adrián Ruiz

reviews.text: All considered, director Patty Jenkins has crafted a film that is about to unexpectedly revive the maligned reputation of the DCEU on the big screen, and it couldn't have arrived at a better time.
reviews.author: Nick Reilly

reviews.text: As befitting the genre, Wonder Woman is heroic and spirited. The fighting sequences are spectacular, and the story is engrossing, uplifting and fun. There's even a bit of romance and humor amid all the action. [Full review in Japanese]
reviews.author: Claudia Puig

reviews.text: The No Man's Land scene is everything, literally absolutely every last thing that every comic book movie should always be aspiring to.
reviews.author: Tim Brayton

reviews.text: Gadot claims star status, handling the title-character with charm, sincerity, finesse and a look that exudes beauty and good health.
reviews.author: Robert Denerstein

reviews.text: More than a superhero movie, this is an adventure film, and a really, really good one.
reviews.author: Lili Loofbourow

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is not a "woman's movie," but an action film with incredible relevance.
reviews.author: Kaori Shoji

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a thrilling start.
reviews.author: Megan Burbank

reviews.text: "Wonder Woman" lifts the oppressive darkness that has been the signature of the DC universe since Christopher Nolan's Batman trilogy - both tonally and visually.
reviews.author: Greg Maki

reviews.text: Gal Gadot has a talent for making every experience feel like it's her first - which, in Diana's case, it often is. She is remarkably alert. Her eyes and her face are always open; she's always receiving, learning, responding.
reviews.author: K. Austin Collins

reviews.text: This adaptation is very exciting.
reviews.author: Sr. Rose Pacatte

reviews.text: Our heroine leaps through the air, spinning like an arrow, but the action has so little weight, emotional or otherwise, that one feels nothing.
reviews.author: Dorothy Woodend

reviews.text: an exuberant fantasy with a genuine conscience that stands apart from so many other similar films in its willingness to embrace goodness, decency, and an unironic belief in the power of love
reviews.author: James Kendrick

reviews.text: If superheroes are supposed to be heightened versions of ourselves at our brightest and darkest points, then it is no wonder women are appreciating this character on screen... recognizing such duality in their own lives: that of object and agent.
reviews.author: Brooke Corso

reviews.text: [Wonder Woman is] hugely entertaining and provides a gripping origin story for the iconic female superhero.
reviews.author: Marija Djurovic

reviews.text: Until the battering finale, production designer Aline Bonetto and Jenkins focus the action so that even in the ravages of no-man's-land, the sound and fury signify something.
reviews.author: Michael Sragow

reviews.text: A great accomplishment of its director Patty Jenkins, who shows that it has the necessary talent to take care of a blockbuster of this size. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Iván Belmont

reviews.text: The most obvious issue here is an absurdly, needlessly overlong running time of 141 minutes (!)...
reviews.author: David Nusair

reviews.text: A film that has values that are interesting enough and different from the rest to make us smile. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Alejandro G. Calvo

reviews.text: A well-intentioned film that in an age of cynicism dares to recapitulate the importance of the primeval ideal of a superhero: the discovery of inspirational models and escapism. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Uriel Barco

reviews.text: So we have the formula: a good character, good sequences of action and a good story. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Carlos Díaz Reyes

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is not just exciting to watch -- she Wonder-fully undermines DC Comics' endorsement of vigilante justice and glorified bloodshed.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Overstreet

reviews.text: That optimism [is] what makes Diana Prince a real superheroine, and it's that vision that makes Wonder Woman a movie that really thrills. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Emmanuel Báez

reviews.text: The film is full of "you go, girl" moments designed to please the genre's long-neglected female demographic. Yet Diana seems far more confident than the film's director, Patty Jenkins...as a narrative the film is over the shop.
reviews.author: Jim Schembri

reviews.text: 'Wonder Woman' is good, but not as much as I expected after so much praise. Maybe that's why I've focused more on its weak points when the truth is that I came out quite satisfied to see it. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Mikel Zorrilla

reviews.text: A film with a magnificent period recreation, a fantastic staging and an exiciting climax. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: José Martín

reviews.text: Wonder Woman isn't placating audiences with its representation. It's using that opportunity to address larger injustices. It may not be perfect, but it's an encouraging step in the right direction.
reviews.author: Abby Olcese

reviews.text: Breathes life into a dying cinematic genre.
reviews.author: Wesley Lovell

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is easily the best DCEU movie so far and the best superhero movie since The Winter Soldier.
reviews.author: Jared Rasic

reviews.text: It's two-thirds of a terrific picture, and I'm hard pressed to think of a recent movie I was enjoying so much that s**t the bed quite as spectacularly as this one does.
reviews.author: Sean Burns

reviews.text: We shouldn't underestimate the opportunity the film faces: to be a feminist rescue mission.
reviews.author: John Serba

reviews.text: One of the few superhero movies to pass the Bechdel test with flying, bullet-deflecting wrist bracelets.
reviews.author: David N. Butterworth

reviews.text: What really makes the film, however is Diana's spiritual journey. Coming from an isolated, simplistic society into the greater world, she discovers for herself the complex, diverse nature of people. This spiritual journey is one worth taking.
reviews.author: Robert Roten

reviews.text: Wonder Woman moves like a '40s adventure story at times, with a hero-or in this case, heroine-realizing there is a greater sense of duty and service that calls for her to take her head out of the sand.
reviews.author: David Crow

reviews.text: As boring and flavorless as a three-day-old grilled cheese sandwich that's been left out in the sun, "Wonder Woman" is yet another reminder that the superhero genre is a lost cause.
reviews.author: Cole Smithey

reviews.text: "Wonder Woman" is sturdy. It's expensive. Its star, Gal Gadot is winning and hard-working. And yet, what's up on screen is dutiful and derivative and, frankly, a bit dull.
reviews.author: Eleanor Ringel Cater

reviews.text: DC Comics gives us a heroine to follow and applaud. Gal Gadot combines beauty, intelligence, ingenuity and the tenacity of a compassionate warrior in her princess Diana. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Mario P. Székely

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a deeply sincere superhero film, but not in a self-important way.
reviews.author: Imogen West-Knights

reviews.text: Hits the superhero sweet spot between new and familiar, funny and exciting, romantic and heroic.
reviews.author: Nell Minow

reviews.text: When Trevor insists on traveling to England to consult with 'the men' he says are in the best position to end the war, Diana's response obliterates the gender gap: 'I am the man who can.'
reviews.author: John Beifuss

reviews.text: Flashback lurches into tedious flashback, while in the interim, blurs of jerky, chopped-up action and CGI explosions fill the spaces where you might have hoped for credibly choreographed battles.
reviews.author: Stuart Klawans

reviews.text: Here, DC gets its first good movie. Jenkins has come up with a star that can hold the attention of the audience better than any superman stuffed with steroids. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Daniel Krauze

reviews.text: In short, Wonder Woman is a wonder.
reviews.author: Diane Pershing

reviews.text: Jenkins rises above the pressure and brings a solid, interesting and humorous story to life. Wonder Woman brings light to the darkness of the DCEU, literally and figuratively.
reviews.author: Joi Childs and Caron LeNoir

reviews.text: Gadot and Pine [mine] their characters for the kinds of small but meaningful moments that most superhero movies would kill for.
reviews.author: J. Olson

reviews.text: "Wonder Woman" is a superhero movie, and it fulfills the heroic and mythic demands of that genre, but it's also an entry in the genre of wisdom literature that shares hard-won insights and long-pondered paradoxes of the past with a sincere intimacy.
reviews.author: Richard Brody

reviews.text: I love her. I love her so much.
reviews.author: Bob Grimm

reviews.text: For Wonder Woman girls can cheer without feeling a hint of fear. And guys can also shout'Hooray' when Wonder Woman saves the day!
reviews.author: Betty Jo Tucker

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a perfect reflex of its time. [Full review in Portuguese.]
reviews.author: Pablo Villaça

reviews.text: As Wonder Woman, Gal Gadot cuts an iconic figure throughout, each purposeful stride a symbol in motion.
reviews.author: Steve Persall

reviews.text: Gadot carries the movie by combining the charisma of a demigod with the personability of Indiana Jones; even when she's fiercest, empathy and humor are never far away.
reviews.author: Margot Harrison

reviews.text: A long, long overdue movie, given our taste for superheroics, Wonder Woman deserves to be a hit. All the things that go right here overwhelm the few that don't.
reviews.author: Richard von Busack

reviews.text: Just fantastic from top to bottom...
reviews.author: Felix Vasquez Jr.

reviews.text: Although the film follows a somewhat traditional script, it also deviates -- because superheroing while female is a radical act.
reviews.author: Alicia Cohn

reviews.text: A movie with a good romantic rapport by Gadot and Pine, a solid secondary cast and a dramatic idea contained in Allan Heinberg's script. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Ernesto Diezmartinez

reviews.text: Patty Jenkins brings a refreshing clarity to [Wonder Woman], a productive mix of gravitas and winking.
reviews.author: Rob Gonsalves

reviews.text: There are too many villains, none of them dramatically strong enough to be much of a threat, and the most interesting characters get killed off too soon.
reviews.author: Jim Lane

reviews.text: Beauty, strength, goodness, bravery: These are your values, and here is how your values must look.
reviews.author: Jo Livingstone

reviews.text: This is a proper introduction to a superhero who was brought on so lamely in Batman vs. Superman, and the good outweighs the bad here, on balance.
reviews.author: Kristian M. Lin

reviews.text: The film is successful for what it is because it's directed by a woman. It's worth considering the nuclear-grade disaster this could have been with a guy at the helm.
reviews.author: Walter Chaw

reviews.text: Everything about this joyful, sincere origin story feels like a retort - a very welcome and much needed one - to traditional male-centered superhero stories.
reviews.author: MaryAnn Johanson

reviews.text: From the powerful confidence of [Gadot's] action scenes to moments of emotion and comic relief, it's already near impossible to imagine anyone else in this role.
reviews.author: Brad Keefe

reviews.text: Jenkins tries not only to include men on Wonder Woman's side but also to make male viewers feel better about a woman saving them.
reviews.author: Leah Pickett

reviews.text: Gadot's Princess Diana is the full nascent-superhero package: youthful idealism, a body so perfect you'd swear it was a special effect, and some mystical backstory for a third-act revelation.
reviews.author: Craig Mathieson

reviews.text: The action is solid enough and the effects, of course, are impressive, but the [Wonder Woman] lacks imagination.
reviews.author: Vicky Roach

reviews.text: This elaborate and expensive epic is worth it for star Gadot.
reviews.author: David 'Mad Dog' Bradley

reviews.text: By the time we reach the Western Front with Trevor's rag-tag secret agent squad, Patty Jenkins has so deftly juggled period rom-com and epic fantasy elements that even trench warfare barely dampens the momentum.
reviews.author: Jay Horton

reviews.text: With strong characterisation from a largely committed cast, coherent action and a rare confidence in its mise-en-scène, Wonder Woman is a comic book movie the way they should be done.
reviews.author: Alex Doenau

reviews.text: Wonder Woman provides an example of female power that the world needs. Both girls and boys need to see women on-screen just as powerful, if not more powerful than men.
reviews.author: Zachary Kennedy

reviews.text: Wonder Woman has come to save us from ourselves in her long, long, long overdue cinematic debut. And in the best news of all, the wait was worth it.
reviews.author: Mathew DeKinder

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a positive symbol, but the ideology of the movie itself is fuzzy and somewhat disappointing.
reviews.author: Vincent Mancini

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a great action movie, full of adventure and light drama, similar to films like Christopher Reeve's Superman. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Sebastian Zavala Kahn

reviews.text: Top action choreography, a fine cast and a side order of fish-out-of-water camp that director Patty Jenkins serves next to wartime derring-do and Diana's gritty grace is why it succeeds.
reviews.author: Hilary A White

reviews.text: An elegant but intellectually timid film.
reviews.author: Camilla Long

reviews.text: Jenkins and screenwriter Allan Heinberg have created an unassailable icon, one who fits into the pantheon with ease, and stands out like no other.
reviews.author: Elizabeth Weitzman

reviews.text: DC finally breaks its long losing streak with a satisfying effort- and all it took was changing absolutely everything (Splice Today)
reviews.author: Stephen Silver

reviews.text: Wonder Woman doesn't walk away from her first film unscathed, but Jenkins mostly gets it right, focusing on grandeur, virtue, and sheer butt-kicking excellence, supporting a hero who's truly heroic.
reviews.author: Brian Orndorf

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a damned good superhero movie, because it remembers to just be a damned good movie.
reviews.author: Matt Neal

reviews.text: Here, in her own surroundings -- and playing with contrivances that include the character's magic bracelets and Lasso of Truth -- Gadot truly appears to be a legitimate movie wonder.
reviews.author: John Urbancich

reviews.text: Unlike most silly fantasy superhero movies, this one is not set in a fictional locale with fictional characters. No, it's Wonder Woman winning WWI! It is the same intellectual diarrhea of all the others, only worse, minimizing the horrors of WWI.
reviews.author: Tony Medley

reviews.text: What stands as the film's most surprising revelation is how timely "Wonder Woman" feels at moments when approaching themes of war and human kind. It taps into a sensitive spot that speaks volumes today.
reviews.author: Clayton Davis

reviews.text: "Wonder Woman" gracefully ascends into the arena and defiantly delivers a stylish, funny adventure made with heart. After the genre shaking "Logan" and the genre redefining "Wonder Woman," there's only one thing left to be said: your move Marvel.
reviews.author: Blake Howard

reviews.text: A superhero origin story infused with the spirit of feminist adventure, and told with smarts, heart, and a different point-of-view.
reviews.author: Sarah Ward

reviews.text: No matter how the "fairy tale" really happened. Some unknown named Gal Gadot was chosen for instant stardom. And she deserves it! Director Patty Jenkins was finally released from Hollywood jail.
reviews.author: Victoria Alexander

reviews.text: This Wonder Woman will be inspirational to a new generation of young girls looking for a role model who is both physically strong and endlessly compassionate at the same time.
reviews.author: Tim Martain

reviews.text: ...smartly feminist without making too big of a deal out of it.
reviews.author: Josh Larsen

reviews.text: After the offensively stupid Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice and Suicide Squad, Wonder Woman feels nothing short of revelatory.
reviews.author: Christopher Machell

reviews.text: In common with Diana, there is a genuine wonder at work here. We rediscover the tropes of genre through her questioning eyes. And for once, the comic-book movie almost seems fresh again.
reviews.author: Wendy Ide

reviews.text: Wonder Woman's relative innocence and absolute conviction make for an endearing and formidable hero.
reviews.author: Ed Whitfield

reviews.text: The final big action sequence, as now seems always to be the case, is a messy and overwrought CGI extravaganza. But at least the movie that precedes it involves actual characters-likeable ones, even!-exhibiting recognizable human emotions.
reviews.author: Christopher Orr

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a very likable movie. But it was also a very likable movie when Marvel made its kissing cousin, Captain America: The First Avenger.
reviews.author: David Poland

reviews.text: Loved Gadot. The script and supporting actors/characters not so much.
reviews.author: Jackie K. Cooper

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is the most refreshing comic book movie in years, if not ever. Smart, witty , fun and Gal Gadot shines along with Chris Pine.
reviews.author: Pete Hammond

reviews.text: As a period piece made in the spirit of an old-fashioned matinee, Wonder Woman (like the first Captain America) does not have to exhibit the insistent, grim-faced dystopianism that afflicts the recent Superman/Batman movies.
reviews.author: Gary Thompson

reviews.text: To be honest, the fight scenes go on too long and the CGI is laid on a bit thick. It isn't necessary. Gadot's magnificent heroine is enough of a wonder woman in her own right not to need it.
reviews.author: Jason Best

reviews.text: Visually dazzling pop culture superhero movie.
reviews.author: Dennis Schwartz

reviews.text: It only took two women to right a ship that dozens of male D.C. executives, writers and directors, have tried their damnedest to sink.
reviews.author: Rubin Safaya

reviews.text: Jenkins and company understand superheroes should have a purpose other than brooding.
reviews.author: Pete Vonder Haar

reviews.text: The beautiful message of Wonder Woman is that attributes commonly associated with women - compassion, empathy, and protectiveness - are the most awesome superpowers of all.
reviews.author: Mike McGranaghan

reviews.text: While the film descends into the usual pyrotechnical showdown late on, it's watchable, well made and not excessively violent overall, which should make it suitable for older children.
reviews.author: Paul Whitington

reviews.text: Finally, DC got it right -- Wonder Woman is a thrill ride that's entertaining from beginning to end.
reviews.author: Jamal Grootboom

reviews.text: [It's] surprising to watch the dynamic shift in performance she delivers throughout the film, as the naive and optimistic Diana is slowly faced with the undeniable darkness in mankind. Perhaps most importantly, Gadot is also [funny].
reviews.author: Kanin Srimaneekulroj

reviews.text: Wonder Woman does something special: It gets real. In a genre sometimes overly fond of black-and-white heroes and villains, this film forces its heroine to confront moral grays.
reviews.author: Melissa Leon

reviews.text: After her long struggle to the big screen, Wonder Woman makes the most of her first solo effort.
reviews.author: Kirk Baird

reviews.text: is wondrous -- an origin story about a superhero not driven by loss and vengeance but an innate sense of what's right.
reviews.author: Annlee Ellingson

reviews.text: It has some resemblance to Captain America: The First Avenger (2011), but Jenkins doesn't fall into the propagandistic discourse of saving America, but focuses on nurturing, humanizing and affirming the leadership of his heroine. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Luis Fernando Galván

reviews.text: A[n] armoured shoe-in for the most pleasantly stunning feature of the summer (or year for that matter), Wonder Woman is everything you could have ever expected from a Wonder Woman movie.
reviews.author: Jack Bottomley

reviews.text: Invests Princess Diana with possibly the most genuinely heroic characterization of any modern cinematic superhero.
reviews.author: Steven D. Greydanus

reviews.text: An entertaining film with a more sincere, heartfelt and sympathetic energy than its peers - of the best that DC has created in its bewildering attempts to imitate the Marvel model. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Benjamín Harguindey

reviews.text: It's no small relief that 'Wonder Woman' is a decent piece of pop art, messy and unsuccessful in spots, yes, but engaging nonetheless, and an almost incalculable improvement on its predecessors in the "DC Extended Universe."
reviews.author: Jason Bailey

reviews.text: Sorry boys. Wonder Woman is the hero the DC universe deserves, and the one it should believe in.
reviews.author: Joshua Axelrod

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a great yarn, done very well.
reviews.author: Graeme Tuckett

reviews.text: Wonder Woman embraces issues of female power and the need to turn from hate to love, war to peace in a mainstream delivery system. And the female lead is not solely a mother, sister, girlfriend or hooker, however gold her heart: wonder of wonders!
reviews.author: Thelma Adams

reviews.text: I've got no subtweet with Wonder Woman, ninety percent of its running time being nothing less than sharp moviemaking. Yet the true and lasting fun will be to witness its eddying cultural influence upon younger generation
reviews.author: Ray Pride

reviews.text: Wonder Woman gives this long-ignored heroine the coming-out party she truly deserves.
reviews.author: Rob Vaux

reviews.text: With a story that moves at a steady clip and action that threads the needle between realism and supernatural exaggeration, Wonder Woman is the arrival of a hero for all of us, but young women in particular.
reviews.author: Alan Zilberman

reviews.text: Boldly optimistic, this action-packed adventure breathes fresh life into the DC universe with a welcome balance of comedy, flirtation and a sense of righteous justice.
reviews.author: Rich Cline

reviews.text: It's impossible to imagine a better Diana Prince/Wonder Woman than Gal Gadot in Patty Jenkins' lively Wonder Woman.
reviews.author: Stephen Schaefer

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a great movie by any measure, but it's at its best when it embraces and embodies the universe-defying potential inside the heart of every little girl.
reviews.author: Dominic Corry

reviews.text: Wonder Woman downplays Diana's pursuit of destiny in the fight against evil...Diana, like her introductory movie, has childlike enthusiasm but no passion.
reviews.author: Armond White

reviews.text: Gal Gadot's Wonder Woman gets a chance to shine in her own Hollywood movie. Gadot makes a pretty fine job of it too, bringing a bit of soul and empathy to the proceedings, but sometimes it's more despite than because of the production surrounding her.
reviews.author: Adam Sweeting

reviews.text: The film puts in much simpler words the human and feminine (even feminist) discourse already seen in The Force Awakens with Rey, who, like Diana, has to sacrifice, fight and learn before reaching the final goal. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Erick Estrada

reviews.text: Jenkins delivers Wonder Woman's origin story and although it's uneven and overlong it finds humor, humanity, and an appealingly old school sense of honor in its title character.
reviews.author: Beth Accomando

reviews.text: If Wonder Woman is a sign of what is to come from DC, it's a very good sign.
reviews.author: Josh Terry

reviews.text: The action is crisp and thrilling, but more importantly, it's meaningful... In fierceness and sheer badass fighting prowess, Wonder Woman is a match for the other heroes in her franchise. But in courage and certainty, she tops all of them.
reviews.author: Tasha Robinson

reviews.text: A satisfying and heroic film that doesn't pretend or prove to be anything more. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Erick Ortiz

reviews.text: Thanks to Gal Gadot's truly wonderful breakout performance and Patty Jenkins' robust direction, Wonder Woman proves worth the wait.
reviews.author: Brandy McDonnell

reviews.text: Jenkins delivers a superhero movie that's better than those helmed by her male predecessors who weren't Richard Donner or Christopher Nolan.
reviews.author: Dan Lybarger

reviews.text: From start to finish, Wonder Woman is an origin story that is faithful, thoughtful, and streaked with exciting action and impressive stunts.
reviews.author: Sadhbh Ní Bhroin

reviews.text: I was waiting for Gadot. Now that she's arrived, she was all the Gal I could have hoped for... Jenkins creates a hero who loves without fear. She understands the difference between Wonder Woman and the spandex heap of extraordinary others.
reviews.author: Katherine Monk

reviews.text: "A trailblazer and a gamechanger."
reviews.author: Scott A. Mantz

reviews.text: It's overlong at 141 minutes and suffers from too much origin story exposition and middling CGI effects, but it has a frisky, friendly spirit that perfectly aligns with its wide-eyed lead actress, Gal Gadot.
reviews.author: Peter Rainer

reviews.text: Have no doubt, this movie does Wonder Woman justice, as well as her fans.
reviews.author: Vivian Kane

reviews.text: Wonder Woman has what many other action films (and superhero films) are missing: talented, chemistry-cast leads; exciting action; and thrilling villains to antagonise our heroes.
reviews.author: Matilda Dixon-Smith

reviews.text: If you can forgive the ending, like I have, and love Diana for her inspiring character, the righteousness of her spirit and also the mad slo-mo action, this film will lasso you right in.
reviews.author: Soumya Srivastava

reviews.text: Smart, funny and tremendously exciting.
reviews.author: Rashid Irani

reviews.text: Patty Jenkins... working from a surprisingly deft script from Allan Heinberg, has gone and given us a Wonder Woman with a lot more than WW's bulletproof forearm bracelets on its sleeve.
reviews.author: Piers Marchant

reviews.text: Engaging, entertaining, empowering superhero adventure.
reviews.author: Sandie Angulo Chen

reviews.text: It means so much, especially in today's world, to watch a woman who is allowed to be naïve, curious, sensitive, and strong save the day.
reviews.author: Jenni Miller

reviews.text: It's disappointing because Wonder Woman deserves better.
reviews.author: Stephen Romei

reviews.text: "Wonder Woman" is a thing of hope and beauty; it'll give you a lump in your throat and make you want to cheer.
reviews.author: Jeffrey M. Anderson

reviews.text: It's a great superhero movie by any yardstick. But, more significantly, it's a great Wonder Woman movie, capturing the compassion and optimism that sets her apart from her brooding fellow SuperFriends.
reviews.author: Rob Thomas

reviews.text: Gadot is a gift to a genre that was long past the point of beginning to feel seriously depleted.
reviews.author: Kurt Loder

reviews.text: While it is not the best superhero movie I've ever seen, it's one I wish had been around when I was a young comic book nerd, and one I hope every girl, nerdy or not, gets to see.
reviews.author: Rain Jokinen

reviews.text: Gadot is hugely appealing in the role. She and Jenkins have leaned toward Christopher Reeve's first Superman as a model for how to play the role: strong but innocent, a fish out of water.
reviews.author: Robert Horton

reviews.text: Many big ideas are juggled, and while the story doesn't exactly drop them, it does flail about a bit. Still, Jenkins has an eye for moving moments, Gadot is great fun to watch, and there's genuine visual panache to be found amid the combat and comedy.
reviews.author: Matthew Lickona

reviews.text: This is the first DC Comics movie that mostly has the look, feel and energetic aura of a Marvel film. (Full Content Review for Parents - Violence, Profanity, Sexual Content, etc. - also Available)
reviews.author: Jim Judy

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a different kind of superhero film.
reviews.author: Sarah Boslaugh

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a fresh, invigorating entry into the superhero film genre that finally lets a woman take center stage-and the results are excellent.
reviews.author: Roxana Hadadi

reviews.text: Gadot radiates the goodness without sentimentality or wide-eyed winsomeness. Supergirl she ain't. SuperGal she certainly is.
reviews.author: Matthew Norman

reviews.text: The real strengths of this production are its lead actors, the period piece setting, and an unexpected emotional resonance that one doesn't expect from a popcorn movie.
reviews.author: James Berardinelli

reviews.text: When 'Wonder Woman' is good, it is compellingly fun. But when the Amazonian warrior is shown for the 37th time in mid-air, slo-mo battle pose, it is a yawner.
reviews.author: Steve Crum

reviews.text: The most fun I've had at the theater so far this year.
reviews.author: Sonny Bunch

reviews.text: Don't be fooled. "Wonder Woman" may look like just another superhero movie --- but it's not. It's a tour-de-force by Gadot, not to be taken lightly.
reviews.author: Jeanne Kaplan

reviews.text: Gadot more than lives up to the challenge, and is as good at delivering her lines as she is handling a magical lariat.
reviews.author: David Kaplan

reviews.text: Enthralling, suspenseful, thrilling and refreshingly witty. A much-needed breath of fresh air. Bravo to Patty Jenkins! Note to Hollywood: please hire more women to direct blockbusters.
reviews.author: Avi Offer

reviews.text: In a movie filled with striking imagery and visual effects, one of the most empowering shots is of Diana emerging out of the trenches, ready to fulfill her destiny and rewrite received Hollywood wisdom on a woman's place in the movies in the process.
reviews.author: Nandini Ramnath

reviews.text: Gadot's contribution to the film cannot be understated. She brings a sense of innocence and conviction to the role that's reminiscent of Christopher Reeve's approach to the Man of Steel in "Superman: The Movie."
reviews.author: Charles Koplinski

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is funny, exciting and fun, but more importantly, it's touching and inspiring. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Fico Cangiano

reviews.text: Within its clichés and action sequences with inexplicably outdated effects, the film tells a solid story of maturity. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Orlando Maldonado

reviews.text: I have missed heroism in the big screen like Patty Jenkins and Gal Gadot's Wonder Woman. Pure, without cynicism nor sarcasm, full of goodness, wanting to do the right thing. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Jorge Rivera Rubio

reviews.text: The only wonder regarding this movie is that it could be so incredibly dull. I keep hoping DC will find a key to unlock the magic inherent in its great cast of characters.
reviews.author: Leonard Maltin

reviews.text: Wonder Woman, director Patty Jenkins' immensely satisfying origin story of the Greek Amazon warrior reared on a mist-shrouded isle, boasts the nonchalant humor and heroics, if not the breakneck pace, of Raiders of the Lost Ark.
reviews.author: Carrie Rickey

reviews.text: Gadot does succeed, against heavy odds, in creating a fresh figure of heroic morality and might, engaging an audience with an earnest character's discovery of herself and the world.
reviews.author: Kate Taylor

reviews.text: Wonder Woman has action, humor and heart, as well as strong performances across the board, especially from Gadot and Pine.
reviews.author: Adam Graham

reviews.text: There is an engaging, old‑school feel to Wonder Woman, a film that has some of the sincerity and charm of the early Christopher Reeve Superman epics.
reviews.author: Allan Hunter

reviews.text: Patty Jenkins proves what a talented director can do with a superhero movie. She and Gadot also contribute touches that only women can.
reviews.author: Christopher Lawrence

reviews.text: An origins story that's earnest yet fun and exciting without being grandiose.
reviews.author: Alistair Harkness

reviews.text: Gadot ... exudes superhero charisma, which powers her through a clichéd last chapter.
reviews.author: Sara Stewart

reviews.text: The balance is tipped toward the positive by the fact that the plot rattles along merrily, taking us from the wilds of Themyscira (Paradise Island for us old-timers) to wartime London, the trenches of Europe and more.
reviews.author: Chris Knight

reviews.text: It's a bird ... it's a plane ... it's a DC movie that doesn't crush your soul.
reviews.author: Christian Toto

reviews.text: Wonder Woman might not be the greatest thing ever, but it is a damn fine film, and full admission: I spent a good chunk of it honest-to-God misty eyed.
reviews.author: Rebecca Pahle

reviews.text: What makes Wonder Woman work so well is the character of Diana herself, who's written and performed with the kind of emotional intelligence that's rare in these kinds of films.
reviews.author: Rochelle Siemienowicz

reviews.text: Suffering Sappho! Patty Jenkins' "Wonder Woman" is that rarity: a superhero movie with a heart.
reviews.author: Moira MacDonald

reviews.text: Gal power whips up a roaring adventure.
reviews.author: Roger Tennis

reviews.text: Gadot and Jenkins convey a much-needed sense of excitement and adventure to a group of movies that seemed to be suffocating on their own gravitas.
reviews.author: Bob Bloom

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a cut above nearly all the superhero movies that have been trotted out over the past few summers.
reviews.author: Stephanie Zacharek

reviews.text: Remember when superhero movies were fun? "Wonder Woman" does.
reviews.author: Chris Hewitt

reviews.text: Except for the title, Patty Jenkins's big-hearted blockbuster doesn't use the name Wonder Woman. Wonder Woman is singular. Wonderful women are manifold, and hopefully they'll fill theaters alongside some wonderful men
reviews.author: Amy Nicholson

reviews.text: This is a movie about battling evil that pauses to ask what evil is and whether it's necessary to understand its nature in order to defeat it.
reviews.author: Dana Stevens

reviews.text: The film's strengths far outweigh its flaws, combining moral and emotional authenticity with superhuman stunts and a lively sense of fun: everything you want from a PG-13 superhero movie. It also feels undeniably fresh.
reviews.author: Gavia Baker-Whitelaw

reviews.text: There's so much to like about Patty Jenkins' long-awaited Wonder Woman that I understand those who've gone off the deep end praising it.
reviews.author: Jeff Simon

reviews.text: So when are Jenkins and Gadot teaming up for the next installment? We can't wait.
reviews.author: Stephen Rebello

reviews.text: Filled with the kind of humor and earnestness that [the last couple DC films] were criticized for lacking, Wonder Woman is an absolute joy to watch, thanks in large part to its two leads.
reviews.author: Jason Zingale

reviews.text: Wonder Woman succeeds because it understands the character. Not only that, it lets her shine in an origin story that may hit familiar beats at times, but is driven by great character work, a clever script and two great leading performances.
reviews.author: Ben Skipper

reviews.text: Powerful, empowered and driven by purpose, Wonder Woman is the superhero movie we need right now. It's also a blast of summer-movie entertainment that should charm fangirls and fanboys alike -- along with anyone who likes having a good time.
reviews.author: Michael Smith

reviews.text: In a world of comic-book movies populated with sarcastic, jokey superheroes dropping witty one-liners with every move, Wonder Woman is a blast of fresh air -- an earnestly heroic character bringing goodness and love to a violence-ravaged world.
reviews.author: Sean P. Means

reviews.text: This latest entry into the DC Comics world is only partially successful before eventually succumbing to genre fatigue.
reviews.author: Rob Carnevale

reviews.text: The character of Wonder Woman enters the almost exclusively male domain of DC comics movies... Under this pressure, Jenkins comes through with a work that radiates confidence and sangfroid.
reviews.author: Caryn James

reviews.text: Fuel up the Invisible Jet. You're in for a ride.
reviews.author: Dana Barbuto

reviews.text: We can overlook how the third act yields to the blows-up-good formula of blockbuster franchises. For now, let's just celebrate a superhero movie that runs on estrogen rather than testosterone.
reviews.author: Peter Howell

reviews.text: The real success of the film is that Gadot is perhaps the cinema's best-cast DC-style aspirational superhero since Christopher Reeve's Superman.
reviews.author: Kim Newman

reviews.text: The moviegoing world deserves the best that Hollywood can deliver, and this time we've pretty much got it.
reviews.author: Joe Morgenstern

reviews.text: Unlike Batman v Superman or Suicide Squad, Jenkins' film isn't about the heroes beating the villains - it's about the humanity of its eponymous heroine.
reviews.author: Benjamin Rabinovich

reviews.text: Much credit should go to Godot, who can be alluring, tough, goofy and sweet all in the same take.
reviews.author: Tom Meek

reviews.text: What makes this a must see for fans of superhero movies is the performance of Israeli actress Gal Gadot as Wonder Woman. This is a star-making turn...
reviews.author: Daniel M. Kimmel

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is good. Not great, but good. And really, after Man Of Steel, Batman V Superman: Dawn Of Justice and Suicide Squad, that's all it needs to be.
reviews.author: Norman Wilner

reviews.text: It's so great to see a film pay off in a way that will please both its hardcore fans and a general public that has been clamoring for it for decades.
reviews.author: Kristian Harloff

reviews.text: The best DC film since The Dark Knight.
reviews.author: Mark Ellis

reviews.text: The movie does drag a bit during that midsection after Diana bids farewell to the Amazons, but it's consistently entertaining, buoyed in no small part by [Gadot's] presence, which makes the mythological seem possible.
reviews.author: Brian Lowry

reviews.text: The cinematic universe of DC Comics finally hits all the right notes -- bullets, bronze, and mustard gas included -- in what for any other superhero would be a distinctly Marvel origin story.
reviews.author: Marc Savlov

reviews.text: [A] torpid, overlong DC Comics epic ... puts the first world war on a baking tray for the latest cook-till-crisp superhero flick.
reviews.author: Nigel Andrews

reviews.text: This film makes the character one of the more engaging, empowered, and empowering of the recent crop of super-powered heroes. It's a pretty good movie, too.
reviews.author: Mark Dujsik

reviews.text: Gadot proves she is worthy of Wonder Woman's tiara, but the superhero deserves a great film, not one that's just better than the others.
reviews.author: Jody Mitori

reviews.text: The only grace note in the generally clunky Wonder Woman is its star, the five-foot-ten-inch Israeli actress and model Gal Gadot, who is somehow the perfect blend of superbabe-in-the-woods innocence and mouthiness.
reviews.author: David Edelstein

reviews.text: Hopeful, empowering, and enormously entertaining, Warner Bros. Pictures' Wonder Woman is the feature film this iconic female superhero deserves.
reviews.author: Rebecca Murray

reviews.text: Even in its weaker moments, Wonder Woman honors the scale of a superhero who stands alongside Superman and Batman in the DC lexicon, but has never had a vehicle worthy of her.
reviews.author: Scott Tobias

reviews.text: For roughly half of its nearly two-and-a-half-hour running time, 'Wonder Woman' is a better-than-average superhero movie; a pity it falls off so precipitously in the last act.
reviews.author: Frank Swietek

reviews.text: A Wonder Woman film that is inspiring, hopeful, blistering, and compassionate, in ways that honor what has made this character an icon.
reviews.author: Angelica Jade Bastién

reviews.text: She's fearless, whip-smart and she's just saved the Universe. After three false starts, director Patty Jenkins has delivered the first great film in the DCEU.
reviews.author: Andy Lea

reviews.text: Taken just at face value as a superhero movie, Wonder Woman is one of the best in its class, matching some of the better efforts in a genre that Marvel has dominated for years.
reviews.author: Britton Peele

reviews.text: Never reinvents the superhero origin story, but it hits all the familiar beats with enthusiasm and style.
reviews.author: Josh Bell

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is grandly entertaining, offering up a hero whose sincerity reveals a sense of decency and self-sacrifice our modern world could use to learn a little from.
reviews.author: Sara Michelle Fetters

reviews.text: An enjoyable adventure because of its two strong leads, its effortless tonal shifts and its aversion to narrative traps.
reviews.author: Damien Straker

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is easily one of DC's best movies, but it also belongs in the conversation of best comic book origin movies period.
reviews.author: Jeffrey Lyles

reviews.text: It's a winner! Every bit the Amazonian warrior princess, Gal Gadot leaps onto the screen in a smartly written girls' own superhero adventure with an appealing mix of action, romance, humour and spectacular effects.
reviews.author: Louise Keller

reviews.text: At long last: we can rank a DCEU superhero movie over some of the best the MCU has to offer... and actually mean it. Here's all you need to know: Gal Gadot IS Wonder Woman.
reviews.author: Kevin A. Ranson

reviews.text: She does not disappoint.
reviews.author: Rob Hunter

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is glorious.
reviews.author: Roe McDermott

reviews.text: Unlike lots of comic book movies, it feels like a work of passion and vision. I sense a filmmaker behind it, not a focus group.
reviews.author: Max Weiss

reviews.text: "Wonder Woman" has raised the bar. Now let's see if the boys can clear it.
reviews.author: Ann Hornaday

reviews.text: What lingers ... is the feeling of hope that the movie brings, that it someday might be possible for female rationality to defeat male brutality.
reviews.author: Mick LaSalle

reviews.text: Any hopes that Wonder Woman will sustain its appealing misandry are soon dashed.
reviews.author: Melissa Anderson

reviews.text: Your daughters should love it -- and so should your sons.
reviews.author: Ty Burr

reviews.text: The film effortlessly streamlines decades of comic book history that blends the DC Universe and Greek mythology, telling the origin of the mysterious, ageless Wonder Woman who stole the show in Batman v Superman.
reviews.author: Joshua Rivera

reviews.text: Jenkins has succeeded where DC had thus far failed, and in that sense, Wonder Woman should be (and is being) hailed as a triumph.
reviews.author: Richard Lawson

reviews.text: Director Patty Jenkins and her collaborators have taken the well-worn superhero origin story and invested it with a rich, sometimes revelatory depth of feeling.
reviews.author: Justin Chang

reviews.text: The best thing about Wonder Woman, the overlong and intermittently enjoyable new DC superhero spectacular, is Wonder Woman herself.
reviews.author: A.A. Dowd

reviews.text: Every DC Universe movie so far has juggled themes of love versus duty...But Wonder Woman is the first to suggest that love IS duty; if you love at all, you must fight to preserve that in the world.
reviews.author: Luke Y. Thompson

reviews.text: Gal Gadot's performance has the poise and humor that conjures up memories of Christopher Reeve.
reviews.author: Will Leitch

reviews.text: 'Wonder Woman' falls victim to over reliance on computer graphics and it's too long. But that's counterbalanced by a story grounded in real emotions and characters who inhabit a three-dimensional world, albeit a comic-book-inspired, fantastical one.
reviews.author: Cary Darling

reviews.text: ... the lone DC Comics project this century not directed by Christopher Nolan that delivers on its advance expectations.
reviews.author: Jon Niccum

reviews.text: Not just one of the better origin stories but one of the most hopeful, positive superhero movies we've seen in a while.
reviews.author: Eric D. Snider

reviews.text: Throughout Wonder Woman there is an earnestness in tone that plays well, and rarely as saccharine.
reviews.author: Dan Mecca

reviews.text: This picture tries so hard to avoid making a statement that it becomes the elephant in the room.
reviews.author: John Lui

reviews.text: Director Patty Jenkins displays a deft hand contrasting the gentle beauty of Wonder Woman's paradise island with the horror of the First World War. Her movie is mesmerizing, as she allows the audience to see the world through alien eyes.
reviews.author: Michael Sangiacomo

reviews.text: Wonder Woman gives rising star Gal Gadot the chance to... demonstrate her impressive skill set that includes a nuanced sense of humor, heightened physicality, dramatic gravitas and charismatic self-confidence.
reviews.author: Dann Gire

reviews.text: To say Wonder Woman is a breath of fresh air would be an understatement to this purely joyful and vibrant ride of a story.
reviews.author: Allyson Johnson

reviews.text: Get ready for Gal Gadot to become etched in the pop culture pantheon of strong women who can kick some butt, slay a few stereotypes and own a movie.
reviews.author: Clint O'Connor

reviews.text: [Gadot] seems born to play the part. Her ragtag band of sidekicks are a huge breath of fresh air next to the usual super-hero super-groups we're accustomed to.
reviews.author: Chris Newbould

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a fun superhero movie that's well worth checking out on the big screen.
reviews.author: Scott Chitwood

reviews.text: The moral of the story, children, is that the world, of superheroes and mere mortals alike, is all the more better when there are more women around.
reviews.author: Shyama Krishna Kumar

reviews.text: The major problem is its marathon duration of 140 minutes, way too long for a blockbuster noticeably bereft of sustained wow-factor spectacle.
reviews.author: Leigh Paatsch

reviews.text: Jenkins and Gadot did their level best to give us, within the confines of an unforgiving superhero universe, the Amazing Amazon that fans deserve.
reviews.author: Joe Gross

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a strong, at times even rousing, application of the superhero film formula, but it ultimately can't transcend the constraints of the genre.
reviews.author: Keith Watson

reviews.text: Commanding and clear of vision, all the more electrifying because the time is taken to get to know, to understand, and to care about the people onscreen. Imagine that.
reviews.author: Dustin Putman

reviews.text: Jenkins doesn't need to bludgeon us with pyrotechnics. The real fireworks of the "Wonder Woman" narrative are its powerful emotions.
reviews.author: Karen D'Souza

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a top-notch blockbuster, fun and fast and carrying quite a lot of the thematic heft that characterizes the dramatic ambition of the better DC Comics movies as against the more light-hearted Marvel efforts.
reviews.author: Kyle Smith

reviews.text: I blanched slightly at Wonder Woman's almost two-and-a-half-hour running time, but the film raced by -- perhaps because every cliché was subverted by the freshness of a female lead.
reviews.author: Kate Muir

reviews.text: Patty Jenkins and Gal Gadot deliver in Wonder Woman the necessary superhero movie these days. [Full review in Spanish]
reviews.author: Sergio López Aguirre

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is spectacular.
reviews.author: Alan Cerny

reviews.text: A smart, exciting, politically aware origin story.
reviews.author: Daniel Eagan

reviews.text: ...an old fashioned super hero movie. There's nothing wrong with that, of course, but I don't think my strongest impression was supposed to be 'Robin Wright really kicks ass.'
reviews.author: Laura Clifford

reviews.text: I have to admit, my heart soared. Wham, bam, thank you ma'am.
reviews.author: Jan Moir

reviews.text: What's best about the film can be summed up in two words: Gal Gadot.
reviews.author: Jake Wilson

reviews.text: It feels less like yet another installment in an endless sequence of apocalyptic merchandising opportunities than like ... what's the word I'm looking for? A movie. A pretty good one, too.
reviews.author: A.O. Scott

reviews.text: Wonder Woman walks a different path. Her arc in the movie isn't discovering she has powers or that those powers demand responsibility. Her arc is showing that humanity, as deeply flawed as it is, is worth saving.
reviews.author: Matt Goldberg

reviews.text: A sturdy origin story, this education of Miss Diana Prince, establishing her as a compassionate badass who consistently proves her bravery, strength, and commitment to justice.
reviews.author: Peter Canavese

reviews.text: Wonder Woman may be a step in the right direction when it comes to getting the DCEU on track, but it still falters in too many places to get itself up to an acceptable level.
reviews.author: Jeff Beck

reviews.text: The first film of the DC Extended Universe that doesn't seem embarrassed by its premise.
reviews.author: Susana Polo

reviews.text: Far from flawless, but 'Wonder Woman' is arguably the best DC comic book film since 'The Dark Knight.' So, bow down to the Princess.
reviews.author: Clay Cane

reviews.text: A rousing adventure yarn, shorn of the usual fanboy mythos.
reviews.author: David Jenkins

reviews.text: Wonder Woman more than shoulders the weight of our expectations, and dazzles us with brilliant kick-ass action and *shocker* heart that her male counterparts couldn't hope to match.
reviews.author: Travis Hopson

reviews.text: Jenkins (and Gadot) particularly excel in the action scenes, because when Wonder Woman first runs across the battlefields in her costume, you are immediately won over.
reviews.author: Edward Douglas

reviews.text: The film's two major strengths come down to the two most important ingredients - cast and story.
reviews.author: Matthew Toomey

reviews.text: It's much, much better and more thoughtful than [other superhero films]; its depiction of heroism and humanity, more complex. Most importantly, it's a great time at the movies. More like this, please.
reviews.author: Simon Miraudo

reviews.text: There are some moments of bold storytelling, and the focus on humanity, morality and love is an unusual and welcome theme in a superhero movie. (But don't worry, it's not all moralising - Diana still punches a lot of people.)
reviews.author: Abigail Chandler

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a game changer because it is not only the best film of the DCEU but one of the best superhero films ever made.
reviews.author: Scott Menzel

reviews.text: Witnessing such feminine power is mind-boggling and awe-inspiring, but wistful, too. It's a shame that such instances are so rare to be exceptional.
reviews.author: Katie Walsh

reviews.text: With its nods to Richard Donner's Superman and Chris Evans' first outing as Captain America, Wonder Woman also exceeds expectations as an origin story with its First World War setting.
reviews.author: Mark Daniell

reviews.text: For all of Wonder Woman's nifty weapons, the one that proves most indispensable is her chemistry with Chris Pine's ultra-charismatic American spy Steve Trevor.
reviews.author: Mara Reinstein

reviews.text: Patty Jenkins' Wonder Woman is so super, you could almost forget how important it is. But I hope you don't.
reviews.author: Joanna Langfield

reviews.text: Wonder Woman has turned out better than the cynics expected, and has plenty of what fans were hoping for.
reviews.author: Harry Guerin

reviews.text: Her sincerity and compassion are her greatest super powers of all.
reviews.author: Fred Topel

reviews.text: It's an interesting take both on Wonder Woman and the genre in general, but as so many films like this do, it can't escape the siren pull of Big Dumb Action, with a CGI-laden climax that could be from any movie, so generic is the battle.
reviews.author: Bill Goodykoontz

reviews.text: When Diana DOES spring into action, Wonder Woman rocks. It's as if we're learning exactly what she's capable of at the same time Diana is discovering the depths of her powers.
reviews.author: Richard Roeper
