reviews.text: Gal Gadot's Wonder Woman was the best thing about the swampy Batman v Superman, and now her solo outing is the far superior film: Wonder Woman, directed by Patty Jenkins, elevates her from third wheel to real deal.
reviews.author: Tom Gliatto

reviews.text: Gal Gadot is unstoppable and spectacular to see in motion. Watch her fly.
reviews.author: Peter Travers

reviews.text: Gadot plays Diana in appealing fashion. For all her strength and prowess, she is an innocent, even comic figure, who simply can't understand the cynicism, politicking, and violence of the humans she encounters.
reviews.author: Geoffrey Macnab

reviews.text: Director Patty Jenkins's fight scenes are masterpieces of motion. Gal Gadot is majestic. Chris Pine is impossibly charming. And Jenkins has created a film that rightfully does justice to its legendary title character.
reviews.author: Alex Abad-Santos

reviews.text: This is a moment 75 years in the making where the hopes and dreams of millions of little girls and adult women finally crystallize into one transcendent image that is proud, defiant, and a long time coming.
reviews.author: Don Kaye

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a decent but bland addition to the genre that truly shines only in comparison to the rotten DCEU movies so far.
reviews.author: Rosie Fletcher

reviews.text: A rollicking action adventure in the tradition of 'Indiana Jones', with a fully functioning sense of humour and the year's most lip-smackingly evil baddie.
reviews.author: Cath Clarke

reviews.text: Welcome relief from the predictable skyscraper-levelling of the contemporary superhero adventure.
reviews.author: Donald Clarke

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a winner, an immersive origin story with unexpected humor and epic action scenes. Gal Gadot proves she has the right stuff, every bit the feminist icon and hero fans deserve.
reviews.author: Julian Roman

reviews.text: Entertaining and empowering, it's the best in DC's Extended Universe. Physically perfect, Gal Gadot is strong & sexy, statuesque & stunning.
reviews.author: Susan Granger

reviews.text: [A]n electrifying, breathtaking cinematic achievement... Amazing performances, pulse-pounding action, and outstanding visuals make it one of the best superhero movies of all time.
reviews.author: Mark Hughes

reviews.text: The DCEU's game gets raised. Gadot is a godsend, Pine charms, and Jenkins delivers old-school thrills with heart and conviction.
reviews.author: Kevin Harley

reviews.text: You won't be disappointed in the slightest.
reviews.author: Jamie East

reviews.text: When it does get down to superheroine business, this latest DC Comics 'extended universe' outing packs a decent punch and, in Israeli model Gal Gadot, introduces a star with real franchise potential.
reviews.author: John Hazelton

reviews.text: Despite lulls in the overall narrative energy, there are real stakes and sacrifice, along with genuine heart and humor in this welcomely uncluttered tale.
reviews.author: Garth Franklin

reviews.text: Gadot turns out to be as perfect a fit for the iconic character as Christopher Reeve was for the Man of Steel.
reviews.author: Matthew Turner

reviews.text: It has a considerable amount of humor, which may not cause you to laugh out loud but sometimes triggers a smile. If it's possible to describe a superhero film as likeable, this is that film.
reviews.author: Uri Klein

reviews.text: Wonder Woman ends with a sequel on the horizon, that will certainly get made if the movie inspires little girls to ditch their Disney Princess regalia and learn to scare off creeps with the raise of an eyebrow, the Gal Gadot way.
reviews.author: Hannah Brown

reviews.text: Gadot turns in a terrific display as the titular protagonist, carrying an infectious sense of optimism and wide-eyed wonderment, while ensuring it never once cheapens her sheer power and ability to fight.
reviews.author: Stefan Pape

reviews.text: Gal Gadot has an adventure all her own - and all kinds of awesome - in Wonder Woman, a superheroine film brimming with majesty, action and heart.
reviews.author: Kristy Puchko

reviews.text: Gadot was mostly one-dimensional and stoic in her 20 minutes of screen time in Batman v Superman, but here she is lively and exudes a sense of wonder.
reviews.author: Ben Sin

reviews.text: The hero faces off against a seemingly insurmountable bad-guy-from-Central-Casting, throwing around what appears to be a range of fluorescent Photoshop-generated squiggly lines.
reviews.author: Luke Buckmaster

reviews.text: What's striking about [Wonder Woman] is the movie's sense of elated lightness.
reviews.author: Alison Willmore

reviews.text: A dynamic and original film we're so thrilled for you girls and boys to see.
reviews.author: Alicia Lutes

reviews.text: If Gal Gadot's all-too-brief appearance in Batman v Superman was promising, she fulfills that potential and then some in Wonder Woman.
reviews.author: Angie Han

reviews.text: Gal Gadot's Diana is her best performance to date, blending the kindness, power, and innocence needed for the iconic character.
reviews.author: Germain Lussier

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is a beautifully directed superhero movie origin that digs into Diana's transformation from naive warrior to inspiring hero.
reviews.author: Molly Freeman

reviews.text: Praise be, does Wonder Woman ever kick ass.
reviews.author: Allison Shoemaker

reviews.text: Dawn Of Justice proved [Gadot] could handle the kicking and the punching. Here, she gets actual honest-to-goodness dialogue, and invests Diana with excitable exuberance , bristling defiance and a disarming belief in doing the right thing.
reviews.author: Chris Hewitt (UK)

reviews.text: Strong, smart, sexy and downright super, this is the superhero blockbuster of the summer you need to see.
reviews.author: Chris Hunneysett

reviews.text: As witty and heartfelt as it is thrilling - a film that fangirls, fanboys and even those suffering from superhero fatigue can enjoy.
reviews.author: Emma Simmonds

reviews.text: Where Wonder Woman excels is in the pure joy and spectacle of its roaring action sequences, which are conservatively deployed to maintain their power.
reviews.author: Wenlei Ma

reviews.text: It is the sincerity and strength that radiate from Gadot that completely win you over in a solid, however implausible, script. Justice League? Bring it on.
reviews.author: Angie Errigo

reviews.text: What Patty Jenkins is able to do with all of that is ground it in emotion and character, to make audiences smile and walk out of the theater feeling uplifted rather than exhausted. It's the movie we've been waiting for. Trust me.
reviews.author: Dave Schilling

reviews.text: It's a film that not only improves upon many of the seemingly built-in shortcomings of superhero movies, but also mixes smarts, sentiment and adrenaline in the best Hollywood style.
reviews.author: Alonso Duralde

reviews.text: In a genre where fanboy entitlement regularly calls the tune, Wonder Woman's feminism feels like a rarity. Time will tell whether Hollywood [will be] in the thrall of a heroine addiction. But as the credits rolled, I was already craving another hit.
reviews.author: Robbie Collin

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is leaps and bounds above the other three entries in the DCEU.
reviews.author: Joshua Yehl

reviews.text: Like the heroine at its center, Wonder Woman the movie rises with powerful grace above the noise. It's not perfect, but it's often good, sometimes great and exceptionally re-watchable.
reviews.author: Lindsey Bahr

reviews.text: The film's action is explosive and engaging, and a sequence where Diana ventures into no man's land in the middle of a trench battle is stunning to behold.
reviews.author: Kelly Lawler

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is smart, slick, and satisfying in all of the ways superhero films ought to be.
reviews.author: Chris Nashawaty

reviews.text: Gadot is entirely credible as the embodiment of Amazonian perfection, but there's only so much emotion her concerted brow-furrowing can convey.
reviews.author: Steve Rose

reviews.text: [Wonder Woman] isn't just a triumph for women, it's a triumph, period. This is grand entertainment with rousing action, sparkling humor, a romantic streak and a titanium-strength debut from Gal Gadot in the title role.
reviews.author: Rafer Guzman

reviews.text: Patty Jenkins' Wonder Woman provides a welcome respite from DC's house style of grim darkness with star Gal Gadot proving an inspired choice for this avatar of truth, justice and the Amazonian way.
reviews.author: Andrew Barker

reviews.text: Jenkins' feature flips back through time to deliver an origin story that functions beautifully on its own while also bolstering excitement for the franchise's future.
reviews.author: Kate Erbland

reviews.text: It's a lot closer to 'Batman Begins' than 'Green Lantern'.
reviews.author: Scott Mendelson

reviews.text: WONDER WOMAN brings a powerful voice to the summer blockbuster; one filled with hope, inspiration and more than enough thrills to satisfy everyone.
reviews.author: JimmyO

reviews.text: This origin story, with its direct and relatively uncluttered trajectory, offers a welcome change of pace from a superhero realm that's often overloaded with interconnections and cross-references.
reviews.author: Sheri Linden

reviews.text: Along with the first "Iron Man," it's the film you point to when you want to prove that this overly prolific genre is worth keeping around.
reviews.author: Matt Prigge

reviews.text: A bright, exciting film that manages to meld the more epic "gods among us" DC-style with moments of levity and pathos.
reviews.author: Anthony O'Connor

reviews.text: Seeing the Amazons training with beautiful ferocity, seeing women so powerful and skilled...was a revelation.
reviews.author: Jenna Busch

reviews.text: Gal Gadot grabs the Lasso of Truth and the bracelets of infinite resilience to take center stage in Wonder Woman, director Patty Jenkins' formidable and almost entirely successful bid to make the DC Comics movies a little less lame.
reviews.author: Michael Phillips

reviews.text: Wonder Woman is coming out at a good time. This is the movie a lot of us need right now and Wonder Woman is the hero we all kind of need right now.
reviews.author: Mike Ryan

reviews.text: One of the best superhero movies. Ever.
reviews.author: William Bibbiani

reviews.text: Wonder Woman offers a full cinematic experience from beginning-to-end, which helps it stand out from other films of its kind that worry more about what's to come than the story at hand.
reviews.author: Matt Donato

reviews.text: Exciting, romantic, and funny.
reviews.author: Matt Singer

reviews.text: Molded by the mighty Gods, but as shaped by mere mortals Wonder Woman's mettle and beliefs can only be so wonderfully divine.
reviews.author: Rodrigo Perez

reviews.text: Diana Prince's solo film easily stands out as the best DC film since 'The Dark Knight', and 'Wonder Woman' is a sign of great things to come in the DC Extended Universe.
reviews.author: Conner Schwerdtfeger

reviews.text: Gadot's portrayal of Wonder Woman is full of joy and completely without angst or cynicism. It's a breath of fresh air and a total blast from start to finish.
reviews.author: Chris Stuckmann

synopsis: Before she was Wonder Woman (Gal Gadot), she was Diana, princess of the Amazons, trained to be an unconquerable warrior. Raised on a sheltered island paradise, Diana meets an American pilot (Chris Pine) who tells her about the massive conflict that's raging in the outside world. Convinced that she can stop the threat, Diana leaves her home for the first time. Fighting alongside men in a war to end all wars, she finally discovers her full powers and true destiny.
